channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 20 years ago, New Orleans fired its teachers. It's been rebuilding ever since
item.description: When New Orleans schools reopened after Katrina, most of the city's educators didn't get their jobs back. Instead, they were often replaced with young...

item.title: Leni Riefenstahl made movies for Hitler. A new documentary digs through her archives
item.description: Adolf Hitler commissioned filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl to make propaganda about Nazi Germany. She lived to be 101 years old and denied knowing about the...

item.title: World Cup ticket sales are about to begin. Scoring them may not be easy — or cheap

item.title: Shooting attack at Jerusalem bus stop kills at least 5

item.title: A singer's cancer diagnosis halted his life. His passion helped him find a stronger voice.

item.title: At least 19 dead after protests against Nepal social media ban
item.description: The protest was led by young people who oppose the ban in a country which relies heavily on social media platforms.

item.title: Former fighter pilot shares lessons learned in new book

item.title: New Zealand dad shot dead by police after years on the run with children
item.description: Tom Phillips disappeared with his three children in 2021 after losing a custody battle.

item.title: French doctor goes on trial for poisoning 30 patients, 12 fatally
item.description: Frédéric Péchier, considered by colleagues to be a highly-talented practitioner, maintains there is no proof of any poisoning.

item.title: Ethiopia to open $5B mega-dam despite concerns over Nile water supply
item.description: Ethiopia says the GERD hydroelectric dam will be a boon to the region, but Egypt and Sudan say it could threaten their "existential resources."

item.title: 'Tariffs are costing my business $100,000 a month'
item.description: The gulf between Trump's rhetoric and the reality on the ground is starting to show.

item.title: Six killed by Palestinian gunmen at Jerusalem bus stop
item.description: Israeli police say two gunmen were killed after the attack, which was one of the deadliest in the city in years.
